metadata.title: CVE-2017-5630 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - negligible.
metadata.description: PECL in the download utility class in the Installer in PEAR Base System v1.10.1 does not validate file types and filenames after a redirect, which allows remote HTTP servers to overwrite files via crafted responses, as demonstrated by a .htaccess overwrite.

notes.note: sbeattie> PEAR issues should go against php-pear as of xenial seth-arnold> PEAR/PECL appears to have no authenticity checks of any sort. As far as I can tell any malicious MITM can install whatever they want anyway. leosilva> unfixed as of 2020-11-23 rodrigo-zaiden> unfixed as of 2022-03-08.

criterions.comment: php-pear package in kinetic is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it (note: '2022-03-08').
